pinyin: Ao4 men2 Guo2 ji4 Ji1 chang3

definition: abbr. for Macao 澳門|澳门/abbr. for Australia 澳大利亞|澳大利亚

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams

sentences.english: The picture shows the Macau International Airport.
sentences.chinese: 图为澳门国际机场项目。

sentences.english: Base is the main hub of Macau International Airport.
sentences.chinese: 主要枢纽基地是澳门国际机场。

sentences.english: We had left Japan yesterday by airplane and flew in to Macau International Airport.
sentences.chinese: 我昨天乘飞机离开了东京，飞往澳门国际机场。

definition: Kai Tak Airport, international airport of Hong Kong from 1925 to 1998
a port for external trade/a trading or transit post on border between countries

Cotai, portmanteau term referring to the islands of 路環|路环[Lu4 huan2] (Coloane) and 氹仔[Dang4 zai3] (Taipa) in Macau/the strip of reclaimed land between Coloane and Taipa/the island formed by Coloane, Taipa and the reclaimed land between them
Tsing Ma Bridge (to Hong Kong Airport)
to ride as a passenger (in a car, boat, plane etc)
Tsim Sha Tsui, urbanized area in Hong Kong
Hong Kong Dragon Airlines (operating as Dragonair), Hong Kong-based international airline
abbr. for Zhuhai 珠海[Zhu1 hai3] and Macau 澳門|澳门[Ao4 men2]
